data.title: Crash when Pipeline extensions throw InvalidContent without a ContentIdentity
Several 'History' fixes.
data.body:
History is now loaded explicitly rather than on first access.
History will now purge non-existent files from its record as it is loaded.
The 'last open project' is only opened automatically on startup if that project was actually open when the pipelinetool was closed.
History was incorrectly recording project files that had not yet been saved to disk (eg, import / newproject ).

data.title: ImporterTypeDescription properly handles null TypeName values in Equals/GetHashCode.
data.body: ImporterTypeDescription properly handles null TypeName values in Equals/GetHashCode.

data.title: PipeLine tool throwing NullRef when certain items are selected
Pipeline tool throwing FileNotFoundException
MediaLibrary for Android
data.body:
Complete implementation of MediaLibrary for Android.

There are two limitations: The Android song table does not provide genre and album art information. I opted to avoid querying additional tables due to performance reasons. As a result if this:
- `Genre` is always unknown
- `HasArt` is always true
- `GetAlbumArt` and `GetThumbnail` will throw an exception if there is no album art available, or return with a Bitmap if it's available

data.title: Allow loading of Android Bitmap into Texture2D using FromStream
data.body: The same way you can load CGImages on iOS and Mac, you can now load Android Bitmaps into textures.

data.title: Fixed SongReader and VideoReader not supporting parent directories
data.body: Paths like `../Something` are supported in XNA and I added suppor for them in MonoGame in https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/pull/2261/files, however those changes were not propagated to `SongReader` and `VideoReader` yet.

data.title: MonoGame linking fails on Android
data.body:
Creating a project that references MonoGame.Framework and MonoGame.Framework.Net fails to build the APK with the following error:

> 5> Adding obj\Debug__library_projects__\MonoGame.Framework\native_library_imports\armeabi-v7a\libopenal32.so
> 5>  Adding obj\Debug__library_projects__\MonoGame.Framework.Net\native_library_imports\armeabi-v7a\libopenal32.so
> 5>  Adding obj\Debug__library_projects__\MonoGame.Framework\native_library_imports\armeabi\libopenal32.so
> 5>  Adding obj\Debug__library_projects__\MonoGame.Framework.Net\native_library_imports\armeabi\libopenal32.so
> 5>  Adding obj\Debug__library_projects__\MonoGame.Framework\native_library_imports\x86\libopenal32.so
> 5>  Adding obj\Debug__library_projects__\MonoGame.Framework.Net\native_library_imports\x86\libopenal32.so
> 5>The "BuildApk" task failed unexpectedly.
> 5>System.ArgumentException: An item with the same key has already been added.

Here is a sample project, just put MonoGame next to it's root folder (App1):
https://mega.co.nz/#!wI0zAJJL!7xSM0vFbT1KW94wB9h3r7OeUZFk6dOSNsFFv-aMGo6I

data.title: Fixes for Display Issues and Song Issues
data.body:
These two commits commit code that will help prevent some issues on Windows 7 and Ouya/Android devices.

Windows 7: The issue comes from attempting to get the Object Volume pointer, to handle control of the volume.  This is a Ugly hack, that originates from HardyCore77 on Codeplex Discussions (https://monogame.codeplex.com/discussions/453847).

Ouya/Android: I believe this error also occurs on Android, but I have only encountered it so far on Ouya.  When utilizing RenderTarget2D Class to create a Buffered Bitmap for drawing Sliced UI Elements, when going into the Game Play section, the system will at random execution times, stop running, while spaming the output on the console window, showing that Some object was not a Valid Reference.  I have traced it down to being the GraphicsDevice not being properly assigned when Dispose() is being called.  This simply runs a check to see if this.GraphicsDevice is valid, and not null, before attempting to execute the PlatformDeleteRenderTarget() method.

data.title: Add link to RB Whitaker's XNA tutorials, loads of XNA / Monogame in the documentation
data.body:
It's a great list of tutorials ( it is linked from the bottom of his MonoGame tutorials but I missed it the first time, and it covers a lot that is very useful for beginning with MG right up to advanced stuff.
- Game loop including fixed and variable time
- 2D
- 3D
- Shaders and HLSL
  etc.

data.title: SpriteBatch disregardes floating point values
data.body:
SpriteBatch draw methods which take a Vector2 position and/or a Vector2 scale are actually snapping to pixel coordinates prior to rendering (rounding to integers). 

My recollection of XNA behavior, which probably needs to be verified, is that this was not the case. As I recall having to add 'round' calls to all positions passed in to DrawString or the text would be very blurry otherwise. 

Nevertheless, not having the 'ability' to render with subpixel precision is a serious problem for smoothly scaling / positioning of a sprite. If you want to round to integers, use the rectangle api or round it yourself prior to calling draw. If you pass in a position or size with floating point precision spritebatch should assume it was intentional and obey it.

data.title: XAct Improvements 5
data.body:
This PR has a bunch of improvements to XAct playback accuracy:
- Decoded and implemented volume events with both replacement and additive modes.
- Fixed incorrect randomized volumes in `PlayWaveEvent`s.
- The `XactSound` volume is now being applied.
- Moved all event playback timing to occur within `XactClip`.
- `XactClip` now keeps track of playback state during updates.
- Replaced the various `Volume` set/get properties with more obvious methods.
- Did a bunch of cleanup in `Cue`.

data.title: Windows Phone 8.1 - Device Was Removed error
data.body:
Running some Windows Phone 8.1 tests and encountered the following exception, which recommends using an API call to get the reason for the exception:

"Use GetDeviceRemovedReason to determine the appropriate action"

A first chance exception of type 'SharpDX.SharpDXException' occurred in SharpDX.DLL
SharpDX.SharpDXException: HRESULT: [0x887A0005], Module: [SharpDX.DXGI], ApiCode: [DXGI_ERROR_DEVICE_REMOVED/DeviceRemoved], Message: The GPU device instance has been suspended. Use GetDeviceRemovedReason to determine the appropriate action.

   at SharpDX.Result.CheckError()
   at SharpDX.Direct3D11.Device.CreateTexture2D(Texture2DDescription& descRef, DataBox[] initialDataRef, Texture2D texture2DOut)
   at SharpDX.Direct3D11.Texture2D..ctor(Device device, Texture2DDescription description)
   at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.Texture2D.CreateTexture()
   at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.Texture.GetTexture()
   at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.Texture2D.PlatformConstruct(Int32 width, Int32 height, Boolean mipmap, SurfaceFormat format, SurfaceType type, Boolean shared)
   at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.Texture2D..ctor(GraphicsDevice graphicsDevice, Int32 width, Int32 height, Boolean mipmap, SurfaceFormat format, SurfaceType type, Boolean shared)
   at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.RenderTarget2D..ctor(GraphicsDevice graphicsDevice, Int32 width, Int32 height, Boolean mipMap, SurfaceFormat preferredFormat, DepthFormat preferredDepthFormat, Int32 preferredMultiSampleCount, RenderTargetUsage usage, Boolean shared)
   at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.RenderTarget2D..ctor(GraphicsDevice graphicsDevice, Int32 width, Int32 height, Boolean mipMap, SurfaceFormat preferredFormat, DepthFormat preferredDepthFormat, Int32 preferredMultiSampleCount, RenderTargetUsage usage)

data.title: Windows Phone 8.1 Support
data.body:
To support Windows Phone 8.1 with MonoGame, you need to manually edit the project files produced with ProtoBuild. The diffs are pretty simple for 8.1:

TargetFrameworkVersion = v8.1
MinimumVisualStudioVersion = 12.0

The upgrade wizard removes these references:

```
<Reference Include="System" />
<Reference Include="System.Runtime.Serialization" />
```

Otherwise, everything else is the same. Maybe you can call this WindowsPhoneME since not all developers will be able to target Windows Phone 8.1 (it requires Windows 8.1).

data.title: Fix crash when creating an MSAA rendertarget on some android devices
data.body:
Some devices (Samsung GT-P6800) do not support `glRenderBufferStorageMultisampleEXT` despite the corresponding extension string being present. This simple change makes sure that requesting a rendertarget with 0 samples will call `glRenderbufferStorage` instead of `glRenderBufferStorageMultisampleEXT` which allow a safe fallback for the MonoGame app.

We can implement a more sophisticated workaround mechanism for device specific issues later on.

data.title: Touches off on retina iPhone and iPad.
data.body:
Since the fix for iOS 8 rendering, Touch scale is off for iOS with retina displays.  On an iPhone retina its 2x off, and when you go to an iPad retina its 4x off. Not sure what changed with the display rending to fix it for iOS 8, but it has cascaded.

 If you uncomment this line it works.
https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/blob/8d89ad087f296d9e484cd5e3c570d324da08b129/MonoGame.Framework/Input/Touch/TouchPanelState.cs#L231

data.title: Character input handlling
data.body:
Example usage situation:
Player needs to enter a name.

Platforms (desktop ones anyway) have a mechanism for hooking in to 'typable character input' events. This already does a lot of things for you, like capitalization, culture conversions (you get the letter typed not the key press, it understands the keyboard layout and symbol map), etc.

See the first part of this post where he summarizes the issue:
http://stackoverflow.com/a/10222878/168235

Seems to me some of this should be handled by MonoGame as an extension to the Keyboard api, rather than only the polling-based 'current key state' api.

data.title: PipelineTool chokes adding a 'New Item' in sub-folder
data.body:
Open project with subfolders, eg "font".
Right click Font folder, choose 'New Item', choose SpriteFont - give name, 
Exception details "could not find folder named bla bla".

data.title: Fix FBO leak
data.body: The FBO cache (GraphicsDevice.glFramebuffers) wasn't initialized properly resulting in FBOs never being deleted. This is a serious issue if you are creating and deleting FBOs often during your game lifecycle.

data.title: Fixed seams between mipmaps
data.body:
Removes seams between mipmaps of Color textures by wrapping texture
coordinates when creating the mipmaps.

data.title: Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector2 serializes incorrectly
data.body:
Use [Json.NET](http://json.codeplex.com/) to convert `Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector2.One` to text.  The following Assemblies will output varying results.

**Microsoft.Xna.Framework.dll, v4.0.0.0**
`"1, 1"`

**MonoGame.Framework.dll, v3.1.2.0**
`{"X":1.0,"Y":1.0}`

_Code Sample_
`Console.WriteLine(JsonConvert.SerializeObject(Vector2.One));`

data.title: MipMap Generation With FreeImage
data.body:
In https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/pull/2949 we added basic mipmap generation using `System.Drawing` to the new content pipeline, but the quality is not that great.

We really need to change this implementation to use the FreeImage library [which we already use for image importing](https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/blob/develop/MonoGame.Framework.Content.Pipeline/TextureImporter.cs#L85).  In particular the [FreeImage.Rescale](http://freeimage.sourceforge.net/fnet/html/FFB6F9A2.htm) method which supports high quality filters (we should probably use Lanczos).

Note before calculating the mipmap we should be sure the image data is converted to linear space first then back to gamma space after the conversion is complete.  This is critical in making good looking mipmaps read [here](http://www.number-none.com/product/Mipmapping,%20Part%201/index.html) and [here](http://www.number-none.com/product/Mipmapping,%20Part%202/index.html).

data.title: WIP Pipeline GUI for Mac
data.body:
This is an incomplete version of the Pipeline GUI for Mac OS X using the Xwt toolkit.  It can currently
- import XNA content projects
- load MGCB files
- save MGCB files
- add existing content files
- build content

What is missing
- a working treeview. It currently throws NullReferenceException.
- a working property grid. An initial implementation is present, but it is just a start.
- top level menus don't have any text, but they are there.
- dialogs for creating new content files.
- dialog for managing assembly references.
- many other features.

It may be a better option to rewrite using the native Cocoa UI.  Xwt has many limitations and may not be enough for us to complete the Pipeline GUI to a satisfactory level.

data.title: Adjusted ToString() overloads of various methods.
data.body: Replaced String.Format with normal string concatenations as per this issue: #2742

data.title: Texture2D.SaveAsJpeg() works incorrectly on Windows Phone 8
TouchPanelState.GetState() garbage
data.body:
Implement TouchCollection as a fixed size array. 
https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/issues/2876

Garbage free for up to 4 TouchLocations. 
Otherwise the array is copied to TouchLocation[] _collection as before.

data.title: More XAct Improvements
data.body:
A bunch more improvements to XAct support.
- SoundBank now loads on construction like XNA.
- Fixed skipping of dsp effect data to work correctly.
- Added support for playing ADPCM compressed wavebanks on DirectX platforms.
- Implemented `SoundBank.PlayCue` for 3D positioning.
- Decoded another complex cue variant.
- Figured out some of the instancing data.

data.title: Fixed MediaPlayer.ActiveSongChanged not called on play
data.body: It was called when moving to the next item of the Queue and when the song has finished playing, but wasn't called on Play.

data.title: Replaced AVAudioPlayer with AVPlayer
data.body:
Replaced AVAudioPlayer with AVPlayer as it does a better job at playing media library songs and reports more accurate play position. It is also capable of playing back songs from streams.

While AVPlayer is only available after iOS 4.0, media library playback is only supported with AVAudioPlayer after iOS 5.0, so AVPlayer is better in terms of backwards compability.
